results.title: The World famous Cathedral of Chatres: miracle of the 11th century
results.brief_description: A study of the famous gothic Cathedral of Chatres noted for its wealth of sculpture and magnificent stained glass windows. The film includes detailed studies of statuary and architectural features of the cathedral.
results.title_for_label: The World famous Cathedral of Chatres: miracle of the 11th century

results.title: Norwich: a cathedral city
results.creator_credit: Nigel Rea, Boulton-Hawker Films and EFVA
results.brief_description: The film shows the development of Norwich as a nodal point for the whole of Norfolk. The modern city is shown to have a variety of industries, including the manufacture of footwear and food products, together with engineering and printing.

results.title: The Caterpillar and the wild animals
results.creator_credit: Pat Baldwin, Gerard H. Baldwin and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: Based on a Masai folk tale this animated story depicts the life of a caterpillar who grew tired of his journey through the jungle and of being the prey of hungry birds and insects and looking like a leaf. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Catering and hotel management
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Life and Citizens' Assurance Co.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Good catering entails the management and supervision of staff, and the bulk ordering and preparation of food. The various applications of this work in hospitals, canteens and hotels demonstrates the degree of skilled knowledge which is required.

results.title: Caterina: an extended family
results.creator_credit: Gillian Leahy, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Italian-born Caterina works as a school teacher, while her parents-in-law look after the children. She and her husband Pepo discuss the advantages and disadvantages of living in this extended family arrangement.

results.title: Catchment Boards at work: Nelson
results.creator_credit: Apex Films and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: How cultivation of the Nelson Province is being extended by scientific treatment of the soil; also, how further erosion is being prevented by control of the river catchments. Shows the co-ordinated program in the upper catchment areas and river control in the lower parts of the district. Commentary by Bill Beavis. Photography by George Hobbs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Apex Films and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.description: How cultivation of the Nelson Province is being extended by scientific treatment of the soil; also, how further erosion is being prevented by control of the river catchments. results.title: Catamarans
results.creator_credit: Ian Curtis, BBC-TV and West Region Film Unit
results.brief_description: Catamarans, those sailing craft originating from the Pacific with two slender hulls spread apart to give high sail-carrying and stability, have become very popular in England. David Lutyens commentates the film which shows various types of this boat, from the simplest model to the sixty-three foot long passenger craft, and ends with shots of a Catamaran Regatta.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Curtis, BBC-TV and West Region Film Unit

results.title: Catalysis
results.brief_description: A study of catalysis as fourth factor in the velocity of chemical reactions. Explains how catalyst function by absorbing molecules, activating molecules forming an intermediate compound, or starting a chain reaction. Illustrates application of negative catalysts in the manufacture of rubber and anti-knock gasoline.

Illustrates application of negative catalysts in the manufacture of rubber and anti-knock gasoline.

results.title: Catalysis
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description: Role of catalysis in lowering activation energy explained. Use on platinum gauze in production of nitric acid described, also role of Ti CL3 in polymerization of propene. Model of lysozyme with active site shown. Catalase activity in blood demonstrated. Animation by Stewart Hardy Films.

results.title: A Cat is a cat...
results.brief_description: An informative and entertaining animated film narrated by children and set to a Beethoven score. It offers facts about cats and provides insight into animal behaviour. A variety of cat stereotypes are shown. Suitable for primary school level.
